NUS SOC Print v0.53
MIT license
Build Date: 18 Mar 2014
By: Yeo Kheng Meng
With thanks to Yong Quan, Kai Yao, Gabriel and Jason

Source Code: 
https://github.com/yeokm1/nus-soc-print

Write-up:
http://yeokhengmeng.com/2013/03/nus-soc-print-android-app

NUS SOC Print v0.53
MIT license
Build Date: 18 Mar 2014
By: Yeo Kheng Meng
 
Which file formats are supported?
 PDF, DOCX, ODT, DOC, PPTX and PPT in order of reliability. Printing MS office documents requires an external java program download by the app to your Sunfire account.


What is "Clear Server Cache"?
 Clears temporary files in the socPrint directory in your Unix account. You are advised to clear regularly to prevent filename conflicts.


What is "Reset connection"?
 If the app's SSH connection is unresponsive, this is the button to hit. It will also terminate any active SSH operations.


Which method to pick?

 Method 1 (From v0.22)
 GOOD: A4 files. Fast and reliable.
 BAD: Slides


Method 2
 GOOD: Slides. Intuitive auto-layout that decides portrait/landscape very well.
 BAD: *1.2MB jar program initial upload to Sunfire. PDFs saved with incorrect page properties may not come out properly.


Method 3:
 Good: All-rounder
 BAD: *2.6MB jar program initial upload to Sunfire. Permanent Portrait layout. Some PDFs cannot be processed (properly). If file does not print, please try other options or M2. Col x Row option aligns frames to the left.


*Unless you clear the cache, the upload will only take place the first time you use the method. Subsequent print jobs will not need to upload this jar program.
